Officially, the diplomats stand accused of being involved in espionage, but it is widely understood that these latest expulsions are a reaction to recent revelations of atrocities committed by Russian troops in Bucha, Ukraine.

SUMMARY: The sanctions will also hit Russian Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin, the family of Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov and members of Russia's Security Council.

TITLE: Ukrainians pore over tragic aftermath of Russian invasion

TITLE: UN commission's 'antisemitic' move prompts demands for Biden to disband anti-Israel group
SUMMARY: The United Nations based Commission of Inquiry on Israel has come under fire for its anti-Israel bias. One member of the commission questioned Israel's U.N. membership.

TITLE: Bahraini official: Iran proxies ‘nothing new,’ nuclear deal ‘critical’ to combat ‘common threat’
SUMMARY: Bahrain is one of several countries in the Middle East that enjoy an alliance with the U.S. and a rivalry with Iran, making it a key nation in the security landscape.

TITLE: Raging wildfires in Germany, Czech Republic are threatening tourist region
SUMMARY: Rescue crews and firefighters on the German-Czech border have been fighting a massive fire at the heart of a national park for days. .

TITLE: Russia claims 40 Ukrainian POWs killed in strike with US HIMARS, Ukraine decries 'brutal execution'
SUMMARY: Russia claims U.S.-supplied HIMARS were used to kill 40 Ukrainian POWs in a Russian detention center in the Donbas. Ukraine denied the claims.

TITLE: Ukraine ready for grain exports on first ship, Zelenskyy awaits 'signal' from partners
SUMMARY: Ukraine is ready to export its first shipment of grains the Odesa region as partner nations scramble to secure the waterways amid a series of Russian strikes.

TITLE: Russian spies ‘everywhere’ in Ukraine
SUMMARY: Ukraine isn't just under attack by Russian weaponary it is also having to fend off the 'hundreds' of Russian spies that are said to be operating in the Kyiv area.

TITLE: China accuses White House of lying about Biden bringing up genocide, forced labor with Xi
SUMMARY: The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs denied White House claims that President Joe Biden addressed the ongoing Uighur genocide on his phone call with Chinese President Xi Jinping.

TITLE: Graphic video of Russian soldier allegedly castrating Ukrainian POW sparks outrage
SUMMARY: Graphic footage that has circulated on social media of a Ukrainian prisoner being mutilated with a knife by a Russian soldier has sparked outrage.

TITLE: Chinese state media personality suggests shooting down Pelosi's plane in Taiwan
SUMMARY: Hu Xijin, the former Chief Editor of Chinese state tabloid Global Times, suggested China shoot down House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's plane if she refuses to abandon plans to visit Taiwan.

TITLE: Spanish Prime Minister Sánchez suggests ditching necktie to save energy
SUMMARY: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez is encouraging Spaniards to give up the necktie to conserve energy but did not explain how in a press conference on Friday.

TITLE: China once again threatens Pelosi trip, but Taiwanese don't anticipate war over potential visit
SUMMARY: Speaker Pelosi's proposed trip to Taiwan has been met with condemnation and threats from Beijing. A Chinese foreign ministry spokesman said her visit "would challenge a red line"

TITLE: Killer whales hunt 9-foot great white shark in drone video
SUMMARY: Drone footage shared during the Discovery Channel's "Shark Week" captures the moment three killer whales in South Africa hunt a 9-foot-long great white shark.

TITLE: Russian space chief: No date yet for space station pullout
SUMMARY: The head of Russia’s space agency says the country has not set a date for pulling out of the International Space Station to focus on its own orbiting station.

TITLE: Iran government agents allegedly shoot over 1,000 dogs despite sterilization, vaccinations
SUMMARY: Iranian officials have considered strict pet ownership laws in order to better adhere to Islamic customs of cleanliness and hygiene, including heavy fines.

TITLE: Ukraine claims more than 100 Russian soldiers killed in fighting in Kherson region
SUMMARY: The Ukrainian military says it has taken out more than 100 Russian soldiers and seven tanks in Kherson fighting. Two ammunition dumps were also allegedly destroyed.

TITLE: North Korea reports no new COVID cases amid doubts about nation's statistics
SUMMARY: North Korea reported zero new fever cases Saturday for the first time since it admitted a COVID outbreak, but doubts remain about the accuracy of the country's data.

TITLE: US ambassador to UN says Russia hopes to 'dissolve' Ukraine from world map
SUMMARY: Linda Thomas-Greenfield, U.S. ambassador to the UN told the United Nations Security Council that Russia aims to "dissolve" Ukraine "from the world map entirely."

TITLE: Pope Francis says he must cut down on travel or consider retirement: 'The door is open'
SUMMARY: Pope Francis said this latest apostolic journey to Canada was a 'test' that proved the pontiff must slow down on traveling or else risk having to retire.

TITLE: 'Red alarm' raised in Italy while threat of Putin's interference hovers over upcoming election
SUMMARY: As Italy prepares for yet another election, allegations have surfaced that Russia actively influenced political parties to leave the governing coalition and collapse the government.

TITLE: Iraqi parliament in Baghdad stormed by protesters
SUMMARY: For the second time in a week, thousands of Iraqi protesters breached the parliament in support of Muqtada al-Sadr, but there were no lawmakers present for a parliament session.

TITLE: Iran state-aligned news outlet suggests military strike on resistance group on foreign soil
SUMMARY: The U.S. removed the MEK from the State Department's list of Foreign Terrorist Organizations in 2012. The group was one of the first to expose Iran's illegal nuclear program.

TITLE: China announces live-fire naval exercises ahead of possible Pelosi Taiwan visit
SUMMARY: China announced plans for a series of live-fire naval demonstrations in the Taiwan strait as the world watches House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Asia trip.

TITLE: Hong Kong authorities to investigate after massive screen falls during concert, injures dancers
SUMMARY: Hong Kong officials say they will open an investigation into the concert accident where a giant video screen fell down onto the stage and injured two dancers.

TITLE: Ukrainian president declares mandatory evacuation of Donetsk region
SUMMARY: The Ukrainian president said Saturday that the government had ordered a mandatory evacuation of the Donetsk region. He urged those in the larger Donbas region to leave as well.

TITLE: Vladimir Putin targets US in new Russian navy doctrine, warns of using hypersonic weapons
SUMMARY: Russian President Vladimir Putin touted that Russian naval vessels would soon be equipped with hypersonic weapons on Sunday, and targeted the U.S. with a new navy doctrine.

TITLE: Thousands want Boris Johnson to stay in power, but party establishment not going to bite
SUMMARY: Boris Johnson also garnered a few thousand signatures in support of providing him with Ukraine citizenship so he could become the next prime minister of the war-torn nation.

TITLE: Drone detonates explosive at Russia’s Black Sea navy HQ
SUMMARY: Russian Navy Day celebrations were cut off Sunday after a drone detonated an explosive device at the headquarters of the nation's Black Sea Fleet on Sunday.
